class user_management.forms.RegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.forms.UserCreationForm

clean_email()¶

Cheks if the inserted mail is already present in the database (only if it’s been changed from the original). :returns: mail :raises: forms.ValidationError

clean_username()¶

Cheks if the inserted username is already present in the database (only if it’s been changed from the original). :returns: username :raises: forms.ValidationError

class user_management.forms.UpdateUserForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.forms.forms.Form

Form for updating the user data. Not inheritance of ModelForm because otherwise it wouldn’t be possible to update the user data because the username is already present in the database.

base_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'first_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'last_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}¶
clean_email()¶

Checks if the inserted mail is already present in the database (only if it’s been changed from the original). :returns: mail :raises: forms.ValidationError

clean_username()¶

Checks if the inserted username is already present in the database (only if it’s been changed from the original). :returns: username :raises: forms.ValidationError

property media¶
save(commit=True)¶

Updates the authenticated user data on the database. :param commit: If save the new data. :returns: authenticated user.
